New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers are 32-4 in the 2024-2025 season, leading the Eastern Conference.
The Cavaliers rank third in the Eastern Conference with 34.1 defensive rebounds per game, led by Jarrett Allen averaging 7.6.
The Toronto Raptors are 8-29 and 14th in the Eastern Conference with a 5-18 record against Eastern Conference opponents.
Key Match Events: Cleveland hosts Toronto aiming to continue its nine-game home winning streak.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers make 50.4% of their shots from the field, 3.0 percentage points higher than the Raptors' allowed field goal percentage (47.4%).
The Raptors average 11.4 made three-pointers per game, 1.9 fewer than the Cavaliers' allowed 13.3 per game.
Evan Mobley is shooting 57.3% and averaging 18.9 points for the Cavaliers, while R.J. Barrett is scoring 23.2 points per game and averaging 6.8 rebounds for the Raptors.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers have a 10-0 record in their last 10 games, averaging 126.6 points, 44.6 rebounds, 32.7 assists, 8.5 steals, and 4.5 blocks per game while shooting 50.8% from the field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers' opponents have averaged 110.3 points per game, while the Raptors' opponents have averaged 122.9 points per game.
The Cavaliers have no listed injuries, while the Raptors also have none listed.
Others: The Cavaliers are favored by a 15.5-point line in betting, with an over/under of 233.5 points.
